newsitem.title: USA: Richardson sees less risk for North Korea conflict.
newsitem.headline: Richardson sees less risk for North Korea conflict.

text.p: U.S. overtures to Pyongyang have reduced the chances of a conflict between the two Koreas, U.S. Ambassador to the United Nations Bill Richardson said on Saturday.
"In my view, right now America's initiative to deal with North Korea has reduced the possibility of an outbreak," Richardson said on the CNN "Evans and Novak" programme.
Richardson said the situation on the Korean Peninsula was serious but said North Korea's main preoccupation was with its economic problems and food shortages.
"In my judgment that's where we should concentrate on a humanitarian basis on helping them," he said.

North Korea is threatened with famine after two years of flooding that ruined farmlands. It agreed last month to join peace talks with its arch-enemy South Korea, as well as the United States and China, in return for large-scale food aid.
